data.title: visual artifact in RichTextLabel menu
data.body:
Version 1.1.beta1.42d41a3fbc

Problem:
The "RichText" menu is drawn on top of the Lock/Unlock object icons

How to reproduce
Create a new RichTextLabel. While it is selected, a small menu appears (parseBBCode, clear) on top, next to the Lock Object icon.

Setup:
On windows Vista, ATI Radeon HD5450

data.title: Often drop frame 1 to 2 second on mac.
data.body:
I git pull and compile 1.1beta new version everyday.
I found the occasional drop frame from 1 to 2 seconds when (maybe)I use collosionobject(kine or rigid body), Every once in a while there will be.

And I run platformer example has it too,  Need to carefully look at character has been movement.
I play other 2d games hasn't it so have no problem with my machine.

data.title: Light2d occasionally drops shadow resolution when different buffer sizes overlap
data.body:
Having several lights in the same scene with different buffer sizes can trigger this (e.g. low buffer size for mood lights, hight buffer size for "actor" lights).
Moving the editor view over tile quadrant edges seem to also trigger it, but that might be unrelated or due to culling.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GWLItyLemRU

This is the same in runtime as in the editor and is present in

data.title: Updating demo engine.cfgs where name is missing
data.body: Tiny fix - adds logical names to a few demos that lacked them, to cut down on "Unnamed Project" listings in the project manager. (Also changing window_management to Window Management, for legibility.)

data.title: Scripts now have default code when created from the inspector.
data.body:
When creating a new script in the inspector for anything deriving from Object it will automatically fill in the "extends" at the top of the script.

IE. A script on a fixed material will automatically have...

``` python
extends FixedMaterial
```

Nodes have more filled out on them so new users can get up and going quicker and understand the very basics immediately...

``` python
extends Spatial

# Initialization code here...
func _ready():
    set_process(true)

# _process() executes each frame
func _process(delta):
    # Code here...
```

Any node type or other Object derivative can have its' own specific code by overriding the virtual method in the Object class:

``` c++
virtual String get_default_gdscript_code() const;
```

data.title: GDScript proposal: 'with' statement
data.body:
I have a idea I'd like to play around with coding, but I'd like to get people's thoughts before delving into it.

In Godot, it's common to get nodes as such: 

``` gdscript
var node  = get_node("node")
```

Which is fine, until you try using this node 

``` gdscript
node.get_name()
```

but the node doesn't exist:

```
Attempt to call function 'get_name' in base 'null instance' on a null instance.
```

This is a common occurrence when nodes are deleted, and this strong binding between nodes can be problematic. If I have a commonly used node (such as the player sprite) and I decide later that I want it to disappear (when dying for example), I now need to scour my code for instances of it to make sure my game won't crash.

Right now, this means wrapping each instance of `get_node()` (or similar) with:

``` gdscript
var node = get_node("node")
if node != null:
  # do something with node
```

**What I am proposing** is a simplified syntax:

``` python
with get_node("node") as node:
  # do something with node
```

`with` would run the statement (`get_node` in this case), then if the result isn't `null`, assign it to the variable after `as`, and run the code block.

On the surface, this is just a small bit of syntactic sugar, but it also opens up some possibilities.

The first is automatic debugging facilities. While you may generally want to be able to gracefully delete a node using this pattern, it could also lead to unexpected behavior if overused. As such, a warning could be automatically printed to the console in the case of a null result:

```
[Notice]: Null result in 'with' statement in [NodePath] line [#], col [#]. This may result in unexpected behavior.
```

Of course, this might actually be expected behavior, in which case it would be nice to handle it intentionally.

``` python
with get_node("node") as node:
  # do something
without: # or perhaps 'else'
  # do something else
```

In a sense this would create a case-specific try/except block.

Of course, `with` is a common keyword in other languages, and its usage varies between them, so perhaps another keyword might be preferred (sadly, `using` has the same problem). Or perhaps we could expand it to share [behavior](http://effbot.org/zone/python-with-statement.htm) with the language that (sorta) gave me this idea, and GDScripts main influence, Python, by having it use _optionally_ support construction and deconstruction callbacks (`_with_enter`/`_with_exit`?) if the statement results in an object. Of course, Python's primary use for those, file handling, may be unnecessary in GDScript.

data.title: Code submission for OS.get_process_ID on windows
Script editor
data.body:
- 'Window > Close' don't allow to close without saving.
- 'File > Save As' don't save the current tab, it can even save with the content of a closed file.
- 'Window > Alt<tab>' and 'Window > Move left/right' don't works on Linux (or rarely).

data.title: Rectangles intersection
data.body:
Rect2::intersects() consider than two rectangles placed side by side are intersected :

``` GDScript
var r1 = Rect2(0,0,2,2)
var r2 = Rect2(2,2,2,2)
print(r1.intersects(r2)) # true
```

This code works : 

``` GDScript
r1.end.x > r2.pos.x and r1.end.y > r2.pos.y and r1.pos.x < r2.end.x and r1.pos.y < r2.end.y
```

data.title: Add set_child method to the Node class
Can't open editor after using Translation remaps
data.body:
I'm using 1.1 beta1.

After added translations and remaps,
I can't open editor.

this is engine.cfg

```
[application]

name="LocalizeTest"
main_scene="res://new_scene.scn"
icon="icon.png"

[locale]

translation_remaps={"res://comic.fnt":["res://comic_bold.fnt:ja"]}
translations=["res://locale.en.xl", "res://locale.es.xl", "res://locale.ja.xl"]
```

and when trying to open editor, console keep saying this.

```
At:  core/io/config_file.cpp:371
ERROR: _get_chunk:  Condition ' level!=0 ' is true. returned: Variant()
```

I can open editor when remove `translation_remaps={"res://comic.fnt":["res://comic_bold.fnt:ja"]}`

data.title: unnecessary node in navigation result causes infinite jitter when following path
data.body:
Using Navigation2D, I've encountered a situation when the start point (the player position) crosses over one of the path nodes.  The next path calculated still contains this node, despite it being unnecessary.  It's not technically an invalid path, as it still eventually leads to the goal, but moving in the direction of that node puts the player back on the other side of that node, so the next calculated path naturally includes that node again.  The end result is that the player oscillates around that path node forever.  I know this is a side effect of the way I'm using the path result, since the path provided isn't actually _wrong_.  But the node is uneeded, and if it weren't there, this easy method of moving along the path would work.

Example project:
https://copy.com/jqROb71r3JyUCUBd

data.title: In code editor sometimes whole line is selected when it should not
data.body:
I often have a problem when I do some quick copy/paste of variable from some lines around. I do this whith 'double click' -> ctrl+c -> 'click' -> ctrl-v.     But if I do this fast (usually I do), it selects the whole line and replace it with clipboard contents.  
Godot 1.1beta1
![codeeditbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10543859/7284210/ad5b1f6e-e944-11e4-907c-6ea42418e8d7.gif)

data.title: Ray Cast in physics 2d fails sometimes
data.body:
Sometimes raycast produce incorrect results. In my case I'v tried to check if enemy can see the player if ray hits him. Sometimes it doesn't see him, when should. Sometimes it can see him through walls(harder to reproduce, but I can do setup in game if you want).  So sometimes ray doesn't hit object when it should, and sometimes it goes through walls.

This is simple scene which reproduce bug in godot 1.1beta1:
https://github.com/Biliogadafr/Godot-Tests/tree/master/RayCastTest
This is how it looks:
![raycastbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10543859/7284018/400b056a-e943-11e4-981d-9a877b66530a.gif)
When no line is drawn then raycast doesn't produce a result. (ray from center of the scene to icon with circle collider)

data.title: A bug in the function "unproject position (Vector3)".
data.body: Function "Vector2 unproject position (Vector3 world_point)" calculates incorrectly when camera is directed his back to the object, but the point is still calculated on the screen when you look in the opposite direction of the 3D object.

data.title: CanvasModulate make sprites with 'add' blend mode invisible.
data.body:
For example I like to do bullets with additive effect, but they become invisible when I'm trying to light my scene with Light2d and CanvasModulate with black color to create shadows. Example scene can be found here: 
https://github.com/Biliogadafr/Godot-Tests/tree/master/ModulateAdditive
Godot 1.1beta1

data.title: Theme problem with Button
data.body:
This is reproduce step.
1. new project
2. add Control node to scene
3. select Control
4. add New Theme in Inspector
5. edit new theme
6. edit style at Theme/Button/Styles/Normal
7. save style resource.
8. assign new_styleboxtexture.sbx to all state Hover, Pressed, Disabled, Focus and Normal

when click Button on left panel,
Button label is disappeared.

and one more thing.
1. import font
2. assign Font at Theme/Default Font
3. Theme > Add Class Items > Button > add all
4. assign Font at Theme/Button/Fonts/Font

when clear Font at Theme/Button/Fonts/Font,
console says

```
ERROR: set_font:  Condition ' p_font.is_null() ' is true.
At:  scene/resources/theme.cpp:322
```

when reimport Font at Theme/Button/Fonts/Font,
console says

```
ERROR: get:  Condition ' !elem ' is true. returned: __null
At:  core/rid.h:146
```

data.title: constructor documentation is displayed incorrectly in the documentation browser
data.body:
1. All constructors in the documentation browser show up as functions returning void.
2. If multiple constructors exist, then the description of the first constructor is repeated for all the  following constructors. The matching description is ignored.

See the Plane class (current master) for an example of both issues.

data.title: Documentation fixes
data.body:
Some minor improvements to the documentation. I hope I edited the correct file.

Cheers
Simon

data.title: Confirm property value change on focus loss (as opposed to hitting return/enter)
data.body: It would be great if you could confirm a value change by just click away from the property value text-box instead of hitting enter. I remember reading a forum post suggesting this feature a while back. I downloaded Godot v1.1.beta1 to see if the feature was added, but it seemed to be the same as 1.0.release. Or maybe it's implemented hidden in settings somewhere. I know it's not a high-priority feature, but since i couldn't find this request on github, i decided to make one.
